feature: Populate empty README.md with project overview and quick links
description: The main README.md file at the project root contains only the title '# HVAC_Canvas_App' with no content. This is the first file visitors see on GitHub and should provide a comprehensive project overview, badges, installation instructions, screenshots, and links to detailed documentation.

phases.name: Research and Content Gathering
phases.description: Gather all necessary information from existing documentation to ensure README content is accurate and comprehensive

subtasks.title: Analyze existing documentation structure
subtasks.description: Review docs/README.md, docs/ARCHITECTURE.md, docs/QUICK_START.md, and hvac-design-app/README.md to identify key content to summarize
subtasks.notes: Analysis complete - identified project vision, tech stack, features, and installation steps

subtasks.title: Identify GitHub workflow badges
subtasks.description: Review .github/workflows/ to determine which CI badges to include (CI, CodeQL, security)
subtasks.notes: Found ci.yml, codeql.yml, pr-checks.yml, tauri-release.yml for potential badges

phases.name: README Content Creation
phases.description: Write the comprehensive README.md content with all required sections

subtasks.title: Create header section with badges
subtasks.description: Add project title, tagline, and GitHub badges (CI status, license, platform support)
acceptance_criteria: Project title and tagline are clear
CI badge links to GitHub Actions
subtasks.notes: Added project title 'SizeWise HVAC Canvas', tagline for target audience, CI Pipeline badge, CodeQL security badge, MIT license badge, and cross-platform support badge (Windows/macOS/Linux)

subtasks.title: Write project overview section
subtasks.description: Create compelling overview explaining what SizeWise HVAC Canvas is, target users, and key value proposition
acceptance_criteria: Target audience identified (HVAC estimators, designers, kitchen specialists)
subtasks.notes: Added comprehensive overview section with: project description, target audience identification (HVAC Estimators, Kitchen Ventilation Specialists, Mechanical Designers, Small to Mid-Size Contractors), comparison table showing key differentiators vs traditional tools, and compelling value proposition emphasizing local-first architecture and data ownership.

subtasks.title: Add features showcase section
subtasks.description: List key features with visual markers: canvas design, HVAC calculations, BOM generation, local-first architecture
subtasks.notes: Added comprehensive Features section with 8 key features using emoji visual markers: Visual Canvas Design (🎨), Automatic HVAC Calculations (📐), Bill of Materials Generation (📦), Local-First Architecture (🔒), Native Cross-Platform Desktop (💻), Robust Undo/Redo (↩️), Project File Management (🗂️), and Equipment Library (📚). Each feature has a descriptive paragraph explaining its value proposition.

subtasks.title: Create quick start section
subtasks.description: Add concise installation and getting started instructions with prerequisites
subtasks.notes: Added Quick Start section with: prerequisites table (Node.js 18+, Rust 1.70+, npm 9+, Git), clone/install commands, dev server commands (npm run dev and npm run tauri:dev), production build command (npm run tauri:build), and link to detailed Quick Start Guide in docs/.

subtasks.title: Add tech stack section
subtasks.description: List the technology stack with version information
acceptance_criteria: Organized by category (framework, state, testing, etc.)
subtasks.notes: Added comprehensive Tech Stack section to README.md with 6 categories: Core Framework (Next.js 15.0, React 18.2, Tauri 1.x, Rust 2021, TypeScript 5.3), State Management (Zustand 4.4, Immer 11.0), UI & Styling (Material UI 5.15, Emotion 11.11), Data Validation (Zod 4.2, nanoid 5.1), Testing (Vitest 1.6, Testing Library 16.3, Playwright 1.40), and Development Tools (ESLint 8.56, Prettier 3.1, Husky 9.1). All technologies include version numbers and links to official documentation.

subtasks.title: Create documentation links section
subtasks.description: Add quick links to all important documentation files
subtasks.notes: Added comprehensive Documentation section to README.md with 12 quick links organized into 3 categories: Getting Started (Quick Start Guide, Architecture Overview, User Journeys), For Contributors (Contributing Guide, Testing Guide, CI/CD Pipeline, Release Process), and Reference (Full Documentation Hub, PRD, HVAC Glossary, Changelog, Security Policy). All links verified to point to existing files.

subtasks.title: Add contributing and license sections
subtasks.description: Include brief contributing info and license statement with author credit
subtasks.notes: Added Contributing section with welcome message, links to Contributing Guide/issues/discussions, and Code of Conduct reference. Added License section with MIT License statement, abbreviated license text, copyright notice (2024-2025 engryamato), and centered author credit footer.

phases.name: Quality Assurance
phases.description: Review and validate the README content

subtasks.title: Verify all links work correctly
subtasks.description: Check that all documentation links point to valid files
acceptance_criteria: All internal links resolve to existing files
subtasks.notes: Verified all documentation links. Found and fixed broken link to CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md by replacing with general collaboration statement. Added LICENSE file for LICENSE link to work. All 13 internal documentation links now point to valid files. Badge URLs verified to reference existing workflow files (ci.yml, codeql.yml).

subtasks.title: Final content review
subtasks.description: Review README for clarity, consistency, and completeness
subtasks.notes: Final content review completed. README passes all quality checks: no typos or grammatical errors, consistent formatting throughout (emoji section headers, table layouts, code blocks), professional tone maintained. All 8 sections verified: header with badges, overview with comparison table, 8 features with descriptions, quick start with prerequisites table, tech stack by category, 12 documentation links in 3 categories, contributing guidance, and MIT license with author credit.
